title: OLTP vs OLAP ‚öñÔ∏è
ques: What's the difference between **OLTP and OLAP**?

answer.content:
### Comparison:

| Aspect | OLTP | OLAP |
|--------|------|------|
| Purpose | Transactions | Analysis |
| Queries | Simple, fast | Complex, slow |
| Data | Current | Historical |
| Users | Many | Few |

### Data Mart:

**Definition:** Subject-specific subset of data warehouse.

### Types:
| Type | Source |
|------|--------|
| Dependent | From warehouse |
| Independent | Direct from sources |

### Architectures:

| Architecture | Characteristics |
|--------------|----------------|
| Inmon (top-down) | Normalized, enterprise-first |
| Kimball (bottom-up) | Dimensional, marts-first |
| Hybrid | Combines both |

title: ETL in DW üîÑ
ques: What is the role of **ETL** in data warehousing?

answer.content:
### ETL Role:

| Phase | Purpose |
|-------|--------|
| Extract | Gather from sources |
| Transform | Clean, conform, aggregate |
| Load | Populate warehouse |

### Comparison:

| Aspect | Cloud | On-premise |
|--------|-------|------------|
| Cost | OpEx | CapEx |
| Scaling | Elastic | Limited |
| Maintenance | Managed | Self-managed |

title: DW Benefits üìà
ques: What are the **benefits** of a data warehouse?

answer.content:
### DW Benefits:

| Benefit | Value |
|---------|------|
| Single source of truth | Consistency |
| Historical analysis | Trend insights |
| Faster queries | Optimized for analytics |
| Separation | Don't impact operations |
